responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: SQL Injection in Top 10 plugin <= 2.6.2
    analysis: |
      The `tptn_tag_search` AJAX action in `includes/admin/js/top-10-suggest.js` is vulnerable to SQL injection.
      An attacker can control the `q` parameter and inject arbitrary SQL code because the parameter is not sanitized before use in a SQL query.
    cwe: CWE-89
    function_names:
      - $.fn.tptnTagsSuggest
    filenames:
      - includes/admin/js/top-10-suggest.js
    classification: very promising
  - headline: Reflected Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) via Plugin Settings Import
    analysis: |
      The plugin settings import functionality in `includes/admin/import-export.php` is vulnerable to reflected cross-site scripting (XSS).
      An attacker can inject arbitrary JavaScript code into the settings file, which will be executed when an administrator imports the malicious file.
    cwe: CWE-79
    function_names: []
    filenames:
      - includes/admin/import-export.php
    classification: slightly promising
```

leads.headline: SQL Injection in Top 10 plugin <= 2.6.2
leads.analysis:
The tptn_tag_search AJAX action in includes/admin/js/top-10-suggest.js is vulnerable to SQL injection.
An attacker can control the q parameter and inject arbitrary SQL code because the parameter is not sanitized before use in a SQL query.

leads.headline: Reflected Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) via Plugin Settings Import
leads.analysis:
The plugin settings import functionality in includes/admin/import-export.php is vulnerable to reflected cross-site scripting (XSS).
An attacker can inject arbitrary JavaScript code into the settings file, which will be executed when an administrator imports the malicious file.
